content:
While looking at #84429 (an ICE when running code against -Z unstable-options --edition 2021) I was thinking if it makes sense to start grouping with a specific label issues related to the 2021 edition.
What do you think? (did a bit of search on zulip and couldn't find if the idea already aired and/or perhaps dropped)

cc @Wesley Wiser @pnkfelix (others?)

We have the lang-team-202x-edition, which has been used to label Edition 2021â€“related issues, as well as issues relating to future editions. But I've thought before about suggesting that we have a specific one for the 2021 edition. I think that would be a good idea.
Maybe something like A-edition-2021? We already have A-edition-2018-lints and A-rust-2018-preview.

Camelid said:

Maybe something like A-edition-2021? We already have A-edition-2018-lints and A-rust-2018-preview.

I like this idea! Did you already push a proposal for that? I don't know, maybe t-infra and/or t-lang might be interested.

This label is just something I thought asking about (I'm sure it has already been discussed in other places)
I haven't mentioned this elsewhere, no. But I think all that's needed is asking what people think in #t-lang.

I was writing on #t-lang when I noticed that Eric Huss applied A-edition-2021 on that issue
https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/84429#event-4642192158

so I guess this answers my question
I guess they had the same idea :)
